radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous pulmonary masses (up to 4 cm in diameter) at the lung bases, hepatomegaly with lesions in the liver (up to 13 cm by 9 cm), massive retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, and gynecomastia.
Bilateral, well-circumscribed pulmonary nodules and masses.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Contrast-enhanced CT scans of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral pulmonary nodules and masses, greatest distribution in the lower lung zones; no notable mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy; bilateral, symmetric gynecomastia; multiple heterogeneous masses in the liver (up to 11 cm); necrotic retroperitoneal nodal mass observed.
An area of calcification in the right lower testicle; dimensions of the right testis were 4.0 cm by 2.8 cm by 2.1 cm, and the left testis were 3.7 cm by 2.6 cm by 2.0 cm.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the head
